result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott J Behnke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.

Huber / work release granted for any purpose the Law allows.
Good time and credit for 21 days on this case
Consecutive to: 14CM230
Provide a DNA sample while serving remaining jail sentence.

No contest to Count 1, dismiss and read in Count 2.

Defendant Scott J Behnke in court with attorney Ronald Duane Haacke.  Defendant Scott J Behnke in custody.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.
no contact with E.G. directly or indirectly whether released from custody or not, no contact with Bonduel Schools or their facilities or their buses

Effective 12-1-15, cash bond amended to $1,000 signature bond with conditions:  No contact with EG directly or indirectly whether released from custody or not.  No contact with Bonduel Schools or their facilities or their buses.

Defendant Scott J Behnke not in court.   Defendant has been in custody almost 60 days unable to post cash bond.  Tomorrow, Dec. 1, 2015 convert the cash bond to a signature bond with all conditions remaining.

Defendant Scott J Behnke in court with attorney Ronald Duane Haacke.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
